paper_abstract: For a given simple graph G, the energy of G, denoted by epsilon(G), is defined as the sum of the absolute values of all eigenvalues of its adjacency matrix, which was introduced by Gutman. A graph G of order n is said to be borderenergetic if its energy equals the energy of the complete graph K-n, i.e., if epsilon(G) = 2(n - 1). The problem of finding all the borderenergetic graphs on n vertices tends to be very complicated. Recently, Gong at al. gave complete lists of non-complete borderenergetic graphs on n = 7, 8, 9 vertices, and there is no non-complete borderenergetic graph on n <= 6 vertices. However, the problem becomes very difficult when n > 9. In this paper, we use a computer search to find out all the borderenergetic graphs on n = 10 vertices. The number of such graphs is 47, among which 37 are non-cospectral. This could provide experience for further study on the borderenergetic graphs with large number of vertices.
paper_title: A Computer Search for the Borderenergetic Graphs of Order 10
